description: From Middle English hevenely, hevenly, from Old English heofonlīċ (“heavenly, celestial; chaste”); equivalent to heaven +‎ -ly.

adjectives.description: heavenly (comparative heavenlier or more heavenly, superlative heavenliest or most heavenly)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to the heaven believed in by many religions.
examples: Synonyms: celestial, (obsolete) celest, paradisal, paradisaical, paradisaic, paradisic

entries.meaning: Synonym of celestial: of or pertaining to the heavens, the sky regarded as the realm of the sun, moon, planets, and stars.
Of or pertaining to the kingdom of God.
(figurative) Strongly or sublimely beautiful or pleasurable.
examples: Synonyms: beatific, blissful, divine, delightful, heavenlike, wonderful
Oh, please continue giving me a massage—it's absolutely heavenly.

adverbs.description: heavenly (comparative more heavenly, superlative most heavenly)

entries.meaning: In a manner like that of heaven; by the influence or agency of heaven; divinely, miraculously.
To a degree such as to elicit great pleasure.
